column4: can anyone advise me on a sane method of dual booting, whereby you share the home folder between different OSes, but have seperate settings for each distro
Yeah - why they don't seperate the settings is beyond me

I've stopped putting any kind of documents in the local folders in home.. instead I have network mapped directory that ends up as ~/SlartsDocuments   where I put all my things.. then each distro gets it's own settings but I can share my documents between different computers/installs
I think creating a seperate data partition is the neatest way so far, b ut still a daft way of doing things
